name: Hard The Age of Apocalypse Quiz / Test | Marvel Comics | 25 Questions

questions.text: Whom is Magneto married to?
questions.explanation:
Rogue.

	Magneto and Rogue can touch each other due to Rogue's permanent absorption of Polaris' magnetic powers, similar to Magneto's own. They have a son together, Charles.

questions.text: Which character led the X-Ternals?
questions.explanation:
Gambit.

	Gambit is normally romantically linked with Rogue, and in this timeline he still had feelings for her. This caused him to not directly join the X-Men, but rather form the guerrilla group the X-Ternals.

questions.text: Gambit kills Pyro.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Gambit kills Colossus, not Pyro. Colossus had lost his sister Illyana years prior, and when he was given a chance to get her back he went insane, injuring or killing many X-Men, including his own wife.

questions.text: Cyclops lost his eye in battle with Wolverine. By what codename is Wolverine known in this timeline?
questions.explanation:
Weapon X.

	In a one-on-one duel, Cyclops blasted off one of Weapon X's hands, and Weapon X cut out one of Cyclops' eyes.

questions.text: How did Iceman die?
options: He evaporated while marooned in the Sahara
questions.explanation:
Colossus shattered him.

	When he went crazy, Colossus killed or injured many X-Men. The Age of Apocalypse version of Iceman is much more powerful than his normal counterpart.

questions.text: Who killed Charles Xavier?
questions.explanation:
Legion.

	Legion is Xavier's son, who travelled back in time to kill Magneto before he could become a villain. As Legion was about to deal the killing blow, Xavier leapt in front, being mortally wounded in the process.

questions.text: Where are the X-Men trained?
questions.explanation:
Wundagore Mountain.

	After the death of Xavier, Magneto founded the X-Men with his children Quicksilver and the Scarlet Witch. He trained his X-Men on top of Wundagore Mountain.

questions.text: Gambit is charged with stealing the M'Kraan crystal.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Magneto selects Gambit and the X-Ternals to steal the M'Kraan crystal, which is needed to set the timeline right. Luckily Gambit has a way to get halfway across the universe: the mutant Lila Cheney.

questions.text: Who leads the Starjammers?
questions.explanation:
Deathbird.

	In the normal timeline, Christopher Summers leads the Starjammers. Christopher Summers is the father of Scott Summers, otherwise known as Cyclops. Deathbird is the crazed relative of Lilandra.

questions.text: Which one of these characters does NOT dwell in Avalon?
questions.explanation:
Strong Guy.

	Strong Guy is known in the Age of Apocalypse timeline as Guido, and is a member of Gambit's X-Ternals. Destiny is a precognitive mutant who set up the safe haven known as Avalon in response to the violence between Apocalypse and the opposing factions.

questions.text: Mystique leads the Pale Riders.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Damask leads the Pale Riders, a group loyal to Apocalypse. A telepath, Damask turns on her team and kills them as they are invading Avalon.

questions.text: Destiny returns to America with Nightcrawler after the death of her adoptive son. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Douglas.

	In normal continuity, Douglas was known as Cypher, a member of the New Mutants. Douglas died in place of his mother at the hands of the Shadow King.

questions.text: Sabretooth seemingly dies at the hands of which villain?
questions.explanation:
Holocaust.

	Holocaust rips Sabretooth's chest open and chains him to a rock. Blink, Sabretooth's protege, goes mad with grief and causes major damage to Holocaust and the surrounding area.

questions.text: Storm realizes that she is falling in love with which fellow member of the X-Men?
questions.explanation:
Quicksilver.

	Storm accompanies Quicksilver on his duel with Abyss, the newest of Apocalypse's Horsemen. Literally running Abyss in circles, Quicksilver wins the duel.

questions.text: The Madri are all duplicates of which mutant?
questions.explanation:
Jamie Madrox.

	Madrox's codename is Multiple Man, able to make exact duplicates of himself by physical contact. The Madri would be crippled if Madrox were to die, and it is for this reason that Madrox begs to be killed at the hands of Quicksilver and Banshee.

questions.text: Who sacrifices his life to finally defeat Abyss?
questions.explanation:
Banshee.

	Banshee allows himself to be sucked inside Abyss, and shatters him from the inside out using his sonic scream.

questions.text: Generation Next were sacrificed to rescue Illyana Rasputin, baby sister of Colossus.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Colossus is married to Shadowcat in this reality, although she would later die at the hands of her crazed husband. Shadowcat carried imitation claws, copied from those of Weapon X.

questions.text: Carol Danvers is an old friend of Weapon X. Whom does she die fighting?
questions.explanation:
Donald Pierce.

	Donald Pierce is a cyborg with super strength who battled Weapon X and Danvers at Wundagore Mountain. Battling atop an airplane, Danvers knocks both herself and Pierce off the craft and detonates a hand grenade, apparently killing them both. They both return, Danvers as a cyborg, and battle Weapon X.

questions.text: Which member of the Human High Council was really working for Apocalypse?
questions.explanation:
Brian Braddock.

	In normal continuity, Braddock is the superpowered hero Captain Britain, given enhanced strength and flight by none other than the Arthurian sorceror Merlin!

questions.text: Havok has a secret romance with which human?
questions.explanation:
Scarlett Mackenzie.

	Scarlett is a singer at Heaven, the nightclub owned and operated by Warren Worthington, the Angel. Their romance goes against Apocalypse's anti-miscegenation rule.

questions.text: Where does Havok incapacitate Jean Grey?
questions.explanation:
Sinister's Lab.

	Grey has gone to Sinister hoping to join forces with him and defeat Apocalypse. Finding it in ruins, she leaves herself open to attack by Havok, who knocks her out.

questions.text: Nate Grey is living with a group of mutants. Who is NOT among their numbers?
questions.explanation:
Leech.

	Nate was bred from the DNA of Scott Summers and Jean Grey and had such powers as to defeat Apocalypse! He escaped and took up with a small resistance cell led by Forge.

questions.text: Who leads the team of bounty hunters that kills Mastermind?
questions.explanation:
Domino.

	Domino is also a mercenary in normal continuity, although she had been a member of X-Force along with Cable. Mastermind, in normal continuity, was allied with the Hellfire Club and once held Jean Grey under his influence.

questions.text: What does Forge tell Nate Grey to do right before dying?
questions.explanation:
Find Magneto.

	Forge, in normal continuty, has been allied with the X-Men and other mutant superhero groups. In the Age of Apocalypse timeline he is more machine than man, and the mentor of Nate Grey.

questions.text: Where is Bishop sent?
questions.correct: To Israel, twenty years in the past.
options: To Ireland, twenty years in the past.
To Israel, ten years in the past.
questions.explanation:
To Israel, twenty years in the past.

	Only Destiny, Illyana and Bishop can enter the M'Kraan crystal and set the timeline right. Bishop is sent to Israel twenty years in the past to save Xavier's life, and Dark Beast and Sugar Man also escape.
